headline: Georgia Power says it needs a huge increase in power capacity to meet data center demand
summary: With data centers flooding into Georgia, utility regulators face a big decision: Should they let Georgia Power Co. spend more than $15 billion to increase its electricity capacity by 50% over the next six years to serve computer complexes?  It would be one of the biggest build-outs in the U.S. to meet the insatiable electricity demand from developers of artificial intelligence.  The largest subsidiary of Atlanta-based Southern Co., Georgia Power said in testimony filed last month that the build-out will boost the state's economy and “allow Georgia to contribute to the nation’s focus on the global importance of artificial intelligence and the digital economy.”

The largest subsidiary of Atlanta-based Southern Co., Georgia Power said in testimony filed last month that the build-out will boost the state's economy and “allow Georgia to contribute to the nation’s focus on the global importance of artificial intelligence and the digital economy.”
